Description: Round-topped limestone stela depicting the deceased woman seated before an offering-table and the standing figure of her sister; wedjat-eyes and Hieroglyphic text above; row of Hieroglyphic text below.
Curator's comments: PM VII: 406 See now A. Meza, Ancient Egypt in Malta in Egyptology at the Dawn of the 21st Century III, 307-314. See also C. Testa, in Heritage 74: an encyclopaedia of Maltese culture and civilisation, 1473-7. PM VII, p.406
Bibliographic references: Hall 1925 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 7. (pl.10)
Young et al 2009 / Egyptian stelae from Malta (p.23-30, p.25, fig.3, p.26, fig.6, p.28, fig.7b)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom
Acquisition notes: Object has 'Salt 1835' painted on the side of it.
